朱仕正研究员简介
 
1985年2月获中科院上海有机化学研究所理学博士学位, 1985-1989年赴美分别在Polytechnic University of New York和Clemson University做博士后研究。1989年4月回到上海有机所，从事含氟杂环化合物合成方法学，含氟活泼中间体和分子间非共价相互作用的研究，迄今已发表SCI论文280余篇，申请专利10余项，出版书籍3本。先后在世界氟化学会议，欧洲氟化学会议（系列会议），美国冬季氟化学会议、日本化学会氟化学会议作邀请报告和特邀报告。1990年被授予有突出贡献的国家博士学位获得者，1992年获国务院特殊津贴，1998年-2001年到宁波市科委挂职副主任，2000年获中国科学院科技副职一等奖，2001年获宁波市政府颁发的“宁波市科技合作特别奖”， 2002年和2007年先后二次获上海市自然科学二等奖。2004年2月至2006年2月任广东省科技厅副厅长。从2006年3月—2009年3月在国家自然科学基金委员会任化学部流动项目主任。

姚钟平博士简介
  
Dr Zhongping Yao received his BSc degree in 1988 and MSc degree in 1991 both from Fudan University, and PhD degree in 2000 from The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. He received postdoctoral training in Prof. Catherine Fenselau’s group at University of Maryland between 2000-2002, and in Prof. Carol V. Robinson FRS’ group at University of Cambridge between 2002-2005. He worked at Instrumentation Analysis and Research Center, Sun Yat-sen University between 1991-1997, and was a Research Council UK academic fellow in School of Biomedical Sciences, University of Ulster between 2006-2008. Dr Yao joined The Hong Kong Polytechnic University in December 2008 and is an assistant professor at Department of Applied Biology and Chemical Technology.
 
Dr Yao’s research focuses on developing and applying mass spectrometry to address fundamental and applied problems in chemistry and biology. His current research interests involve: 1). development of new ionization and sampling techniques of mass spectrometry; 2). direct analysis of herbal medicines, food, biological tissue, clinical samples and environmental samples; 3). in vivo detection of secondary metabolites of plants and animals; 4). molecular recognition and protein interactions; 5). biomarker discovery and mechanism studies of diseases.
 
More details about Dr Zhongping Yao can be found at http://www.polyu.edu.hk/abct/en/staff-singledemo.php?id=21.

item.title: 2013年4月8日上午10：00丰盛堂A402Dr.LeiChengwang学术讲座
item.description:
TOPIC(题目)

 

Research methodology and projects in buoyancy driven flows

(浮力驱动流的研究方法及研究课题)

 

讲座人

 

Dr.CHENGWANG LEI, School of Civil Engineering, Faculty of Engineering & Information Technologies, THE UNIVERSITY OF SYDNEY

 

主持人：吕树申教授

 

时　间：4月8日上午10：00

 

地　点：丰盛堂A402

 

ABSTRACT

(讲座内容简介)

 

Buoyancy occurs whenever there is a density variation under the effect of a body force. A flow will result from the buoyancy acting within a fluid medium, which is referred to as buoyancy driven flow. This type of flow exists extensively in nature and in domestic and industrial processes. An overview of the applications of buoyancy driven flows will be presented. This will be followed by an introduction of analytical and experimental methodologies adopted in the research of buoyancy driven flows. Finally, some research projects on buoyancy driven flows including thermally driven exchange and transport in natural water bodies, enhancement of heat transfer by natural convection, and solar induced natural ventilation in buildings will be highlighted.

 

 

INFORMATION ABOUT THE SPEAKER

(讲座人简介)

 

DrChengwang Lei is currently an Associate Professor in the School of Civil Engineering at The University of Sydney. He holds a BE and a ME degree in Mechanical Engineering and did aPhD degree in the School of Civil and Resource Engineering at The University of Western Australia in 1999. Since then he has held a number of research and academic positions across multiple disciplines first at James Cook University and later at The University of Sydney.Dr Lei’s research has been focused mainly on buoyancy driven flows particularly with environmental and industrial applications. His research interest spans over experimental modelling, numerical simulation and analytical investigation of a range of fluid and thermal engineering problems. Much of his research has been supported by the Australian Research Council competitive grants. More information about Dr Chengwang Lei can be found from his online profile: http://sydney.edu.au/engineering/people/chengwang.lei.

个人简介
     陈昶乐，教授，男，1982年8月生，山东烟台人。现为中国科学技术大学化学与材料科学学院教授，博士生导师。2005年获得中国科学技术大学化学学士学位，2006年和2010年分别获得美国芝加哥大学化学系化学硕士学位和博士学位。自2010年7月起在美国西北大学进行博士后研究，2011年7月起在美国塞拉尼斯 (福布斯500) 公司担任Scientist II。陈昶乐博士自2005年以来开始从事催化反应以及烯烃聚合方面的研究。陈昶乐博士已在J. Am. Chem. Soc.，Chem. Eur. J.，Organometallics等国际期刊上发表论文。陈昶乐博士于2011年获得美国化学会 INORG Young Investigator Award，国际纯粹与应用化学联合会 (IUPAC) 研究奖-Honorable Mention，以及美国化学会邀请报告1次，于2012年获得中组部“青年千人计划”。
研究背景
2012年，教授， 博士生导师，中国科技大学
2011年-2012年，Scientist II，美国塞拉尼斯公司(福布斯500)，从事超高分子量聚乙烯，液晶高分子，聚苯硫醚，聚酯等先进工程塑料方面的研究。
2010年-2011年，博士后，美国西北大学化学系，导师：Tobin Marks 教授，从事双金属中心催化剂的合成及应用方面的研究。
2006年-2010年，博士，美国芝加哥大学化学系，导师：Richard Jordan 教授，研究过渡金属催化剂在烯烃聚合中的应用。

讲座人简介：
Dr. Andreas Eichhöfer
1991                Finished chemistry study at the university of Karlsruhe(TH) with a diploma degree

            "Synthesis and X-ray structural analysis of copper-, silver-, zinc- and cadmium-
            Complexes with phosphido bridging ligands"

                                           Tetrasilaadamantanes" (keramischeHochleistungswerkstoffe)
Since 09.1998 Research scientist at the Institute of Nanotechnology at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT)
 
讲座内容简介：
Molecules possessing an easy-axis anisotropy can display slow relaxation of the magnetic moment upon removal of a polarizing field. If the time scale of the relaxation exceeds that of computation, such single-molecule magnets (SMMs) could potentially find applications in high-density information storage or quantum computing. SMM behaviour in single ion molecules which was first observed in lanthanide-containing complexes, was recently also observed in several first-row transition metal complexes of iron and cobalt for different coordination geometries. We have studied the synthesis and structural as well as magnetic characterization of three low coordinated trigonal planar Co(II) bistrimethylsilylamido complexes in comparison to their Fe(II) analogues.

item.title: 2013年3月18日上午10：30丰盛堂A402梁湛辉教授学术报告
item.description:
题目：Novel Multi-Component Core-Shell Organic-Inorganic HybridNanomaterials
报告人:香港浸会大学梁湛辉教授
地点： 丰盛堂A403



Abstract
The interface between nanotechnology, drug delivery and magnetic imaging (MRI) invites novel approaches to the diagnosis and treatment of disease.based on our newly developed organic templated synthesis, we propose to prepare a series of biocompatible organic-inorganic hybrid nanoparticle materials for dual diagnosis and therapeutic purposes. These nanoparticle materials are magnetic such that they can act as contrast agents for MRI, satisfying the need for diagnostic purposes. Moreover, the hollow and magnetic core possesses a porous reservoir for substrate encapsulation inside the nanopores and the hollow space. Peripherally linked ON/OFF switchable supramolecules can be actuated upon external stimuli such as local heating, focused ultrasound or pH changes for controllable substrate release. Furthermore, the magnetic property of these nanoparticles would allow them to accumulate at the lesion site with an externally applied magnetic field over the biological system, satisfying the need of targeted therapeutic purposes. The proposed materials provide a platform for development into nanoparticles for the diagnosis to the target site.
